body: @tooptoop4 : Did this resolve the issue ?

Acked. hi @umehrot2 @bvaradar this issue occurred after the PR merged(https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/pull/1559).

http://hudi.apache.org/docs/docker_demo.html
@yanghua I kept getting OOM; have to set surefire with more heap.. do you prefer me do another MINOR PR to increase the heap?

>Speaking about job stages, we saw that the countByKey is the step that is taking too long, with low cluster usage/load (it is shuffling?)

From the UI, it seems like the spark job itself is hung (GC-ing or something).. Do you have driver logs to help pinpoint more? Hudi just uses the `KafkaRDD` that Spark streaming uses and it just computes the endOffsets to grab records upto each run, it wont really wait for 5mln to show., that's just a max..
Are you able to reproduce this consistently? If so, with some driver logs for the stuck run, we can try and pinpoint whats happening..

It seems like this PR has just surfaced the issue. **Avro** should be shaded inside **hudi-hive-sync-bundle** just like it is shaded inside **hudi-hadoop-mr-bundle**, because the version used by hive does not match what Hudi needs.

@bvaradar That is correct..  It's anyway good practice to not pass in jsc.. This was fine with Spark was the only engine on our minds... Doing this reduction, reduces the blast radius for the engine abstraction..
@umehrot2 : Would you be able to create a PR to fix this. shading avro inside hive-sync bundle should be fine as it is a standalone tool. Filed : https://jira.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-884
Thanks @vinothchandar for the details. Makes sense.
@shenh062326 : Once compilation issues are addressed, I will review it.
@bvaradar yes will work on this. Need to first confirm that it will infact solve the issue.
PR created: https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/pull/1618

@umehrot2 : Thanks for quickly fixing it. Can you add a redundant hive-sync call in ITTestHoodieDemo (https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/blob/master/hudi-integ-test/src/test/java/org/apache/hudi/integ/ITTestHoodieDemo.java#L121) which uses hudi-hive-sync tool directly instead of delta-streamer for one table (pick COW) . This would atleast catch issues like this in future

> @shenh062326 : Can you provide more context in the ticket or PR. I see that this is part of multi-engine support. I want to understand why only some API are modified. Is this more of a cleanup where we can avoid jsc whenever possible and for those HoodieTable APIs where we cannot, we will eventually be adding an abstraction equivalent to jsc but hide Spark details ?

Yes, we discussed this before in HUDI-866. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/HUDI-880

> @shenh062326 : Once compilation issues are addressed, I will review it.

Done.

Temporary solution

i add two jar  at run_sync_tool.sh file

/var/hoodie/ws/hudi-cli/target/lib/parquet-avro-1.10.1.jar
/opt/spark/jars/avro-1.8.2.jar

eg:

HADOOP_HIVE_JARS=/var/hoodie/ws/hudi-cli/target/lib/parquet-avro-1.10.1.jar:/opt/spark/jars/avro-1.8.2.jar:${HIVE_JARS}:${HADOOP_HOME}/share/hadoop/common/*:${HADOOP_HOME}/share/hadoop/mapreduce/*:${HADOOP_HOME}/share/hadoop/hdfs/*:${HADOOP_HOME}/share/hadoop/common/lib/*:${HADOOP_HOME}/share/hadoop/hdfs/lib/*

the demo  runing ok

> i add two jar at run_sync_tool.sh file

You're right.

Good job @umehrot2, acked by following commands
```
mvn clean install -DskipTests -DskipITs -Dcheckstyle.skip=true -Drat.skip=true


./docker/setup_demo.sh


cat docker/demo/data/batch_1.json | kafkacat -b kafkabroker -t stock_ticks -P
docker exec -it adhoc-2 /bin/bash

spark-submit \
  --class org.apache.hudi.utilities.deltastreamer.HoodieDeltaStreamer $HUDI_UTILITIES_BUNDLE \
  --table-type COPY_ON_WRITE \
  --source-class org.apache.hudi.utilities.sources.JsonKafkaSource \
  --source-ordering-field ts  \
  --target-base-path /user/hive/warehouse/stock_ticks_cow \
  --target-table stock_ticks_cow --props /var/demo/config/kafka-source.properties \
  --schemaprovider-class org.apache.hudi.utilities.schema.FilebasedSchemaProvider

spark-submit \
  --class org.apache.hudi.utilities.deltastreamer.HoodieDeltaStreamer $HUDI_UTILITIES_BUNDLE \
  --table-type MERGE_ON_READ \
  --source-class org.apache.hudi.utilities.sources.JsonKafkaSource \
  --source-ordering-field ts \
  --target-base-path /user/hive/warehouse/stock_ticks_mor \
  --target-table stock_ticks_mor \
  --props /var/demo/config/kafka-source.properties \
  --schemaprovider-class org.apache.hudi.utilities.schema.FilebasedSchemaProvider \
  --disable-compaction

/var/hoodie/ws/hudi-hive-sync/run_sync_tool.sh \
  --jdbc-url jdbc:hive2://hiveserver:10000 \
  --user hive \
  --pass hive \
  --partitioned-by dt \
  --base-path /user/hive/warehouse/stock_ticks_cow \
  --database default \
  --table stock_ticks_cow
```
@xushiyan : I understand this is still in works but thank you for taking this up and trying to improve CI experience for everyone.

> @umehrot2 : Thanks for quickly fixing it. Can you add a redundant hive-sync call in ITTestHoodieDemo (https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/blob/master/hudi-integ-test/src/test/java/org/apache/hudi/integ/ITTestHoodieDemo.java#L121) which uses hudi-hive-sync tool directly instead of delta-streamer for one table (pick COW) . This would atleast catch issues like this in future

@bvaradar replaced hive-sync to be performed through **hive-sync-tool** for COW table, instead of a redundant call. Its better for the hive-sync to hit its most used code path. Hive sync though delta streamer is still being tested for MOR table and also for the later ingestions in the same test.

> Good job @umehrot2, acked by following commands
>

> mvn clean install -DskipTests -DskipITs -Dcheckstyle.skip=true -Drat.skip=true

> 
> ./docker/setup_demo.sh
> 
> 
> cat docker/demo/data/batch_1.json | kafkacat -b kafkabroker -t stock_ticks -P
> docker exec -it adhoc-2 /bin/bash
> 
> spark-submit \
>   --class org.apache.hudi.utilities.deltastreamer.HoodieDeltaStreamer $HUDI_UTILITIES_BUNDLE \

>   --source-class org.apache.hudi.utilities.sources.JsonKafkaSource \

> 
> spark-submit \

@lamber-ken thanks for your testing. I had just tested the **hive-sync-tool** on EMR cluster. Was having some issues getting the demo running on linux. So glad you confirmed it.

> @yanghua I kept getting OOM; have to set surefire with more heap.. do you prefer me do another MINOR PR to increase the heap?

Yes, It would be better to change it on a single PR.
@rolandjohann Thanks for your contributing, would you please file a jira for the PR and update the title with [HUDI-xxx].

Sometimes it happens, sometimes not, i'm currently not able to reproduce it sistematically. 
Do you mean the logs of the run with spark-submit?

@xushiyan here's my take.

our code coverage reporting works by running unit tests in all modules and then the report is aggregated to one under `packaging/hudi-spark-bundle`. this report supersedes all the other smaller reports since it has aggregates of all of them.

Now when you split the test into two modules across two jobs in travis, the following happens
* job with hudi-client finished first and uploads report only for hudi-client module
* job without hudi-client finished last and uploads report excluding hudi-client module

this can be seen from 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2144396/81752090-a5a6c800-9465-11ea-9a7b-caf87957c20f.png)

since there can only be one report against a commit in codecov, whichever job finishes last will overwrite the other. codecov does not aggregate report across multiple uploads. this means we are losing all the coverage from hudi-client.

Few comments on the parallelization,
1. Travis has a queue size. Usually 10 per repo. Since we are in apache repo and apache has bought 50 capacity in ~2014, we are sharing the queue with lot of other projects. I am not sure if they upgraded the queue size beyond 50.
2. Since the queue is shared, adding more jobs to the queue will be worse in the bigger picture since we are going to take 45 mins across 2 jobs instead of 30 mins for one. This might create bigger backlogs in the CI queue.
3. Also each job is independent of each other and it will be very hard to collate the unit tests across each other to arrive at a global coverage number for the project. We will have to push the reports to some external storage, run another job just to aggregate and then publish that result.

@rolandjohann : Hudi is going to retain older snapshots (3 last commits in this case). Can you list all files in your dataset with file sizes. Also, what does the schema look like ? Hudi adds metadata columns for each row  for supporting incremental pull and other features.
This has been addressed here -> https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/pull/1627

@ramachandranms : Jobs in travis-ci.org has a hard timeout of 50 mins. Splitting the jobs serves as the only way to be under this time-limit. From @xushiyan comment, I see that both jobs uploads report from hudi-spark-bundle. If one of the job does not upload from hudi-spark-bundle, will it work ?

@bvaradar i think a better idea would be to see how we can optimize the tests than breaking up into multiple jenkins jobs.

regarding missing coverage: the problem is more about missing coverage due to splitting up than multiple uploads. since we have cross module tests, not running some of the modules for the uploading job will miss those tests and coverage will drop.

@bvaradar @ramachandranms thanks for chime in.. from the info @ramachandranms provides, hudi-spark-bundle report will be overwritten by the last submission and that submission should cover all modules. So previously when we have only 2 jobs (unit tests and integration tests), it is due to unit tests taking longer and covering all modules so that report was accurate. If integration test job takes longer and finishes later, coverage report will also be affected. We need to avoid this kind of dependency.

When we modularize projects, by design we should be able to and encouraged to run unit tests for each module independently. The integration test then serves the purpose of checking cross-module functionalities. As for the overall coverage report, I think it should be a pure appending of all kinds of test reports without chronological overwriting. Thus, I think the setup perhaps can be improved in such way that all jobs are free to submit the reports whenever they finish and codecov  sums up all submissions.
Closing with a WIP tag for future follow up.
marker for later. closing to reduce clutter of WIP PRs

Optimizing/Redesigning tests should be definitely done from modularity, test-quality and maintenance perspective and having running-time reduction would be a good side-effect. But, that may not guarantee that we will be under the time-limit. 

I agree with @xushiyan that this looks like a race condition with code coverage report generation which needs to be resolved.

@pratyakshsharma I had a new proposed change reflected in the last commit. 

The idea is to not throw exception when no data is fetched, so this is to loosen a bit on throwing exception and asking user to set the class. If any data is fetched, then it is still the old requirement on setting schema provider.

This should work for ROW source case where users can totally forget about schema provider setting. For all data source types, we don't care about the schema if no data is fetched.

cc @vinothchandar @afilipchik 

Please kindly verify the changes and see if the proposal works or if i overlooked any side effect. Thank you.

Regarding RT suffix, MOR tables expose READ_OPTIMIZED and REALTIME Views. _rt suffix corresponds to that. You can take a look at https://cwiki.apache.org/confluence/display/HUDI/FAQ#FAQ-Whatisthedifferencebetweencopy-on-write(COW)vsmerge-on-read(MOR)storagetypes 

Regarding the exception, I am not able to tell if this is a bug by looking at the exception message. Can you provide full stack trace, .hoodie folder listing and cat the contents of last completed (commit/deltacommit) files.

@bvaradar Thanks for the response. You mean the feature of delete? So what I'm working on is having data writing to storage through hudi with hudi version 0.5.0 but I was using fresh build from the git sha mentioned above https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/commit/506447fd4fde4cd922f7aa8f4e17a7f06666dc97),Latest. So the workaround that I used was to use a build from https://github.com/apache/incubator-hudi/commit/506447fd4fde4cd922f7aa8f4e17a7f06666dc97),Latest to do a upsert (so that I can have schema under extraMetadata session under the most recent commit file) and then do the delete and this is the only way to make the 0.5.0 data deletable.

Thanks for the help.
